// include platform-specific JavaFX artifacts so the single JAR runs anywhere
This project increment was enhanced with the help of AI tools.
- ChatGPT (OpenAI GPT-5): Helped refactor long methods (e.g., `MainApp.handle`), and add Javadoc comments.
- Refactoring: Split `handle` into smaller private methods (`handleBye`, `handleList`, etc.) with ChatGPT guidance.
- Documentation: Javadoc for `MainWindow` and `TaskList` written with AI assistance.
DaBot is a simple, personal chatbot built in Java with JavaFX.
It helps users manage their tasks with deadlines, events, and reminders through a clean GUI.
You can add tasks, mark them as done, search for them by date/keyword, and even get reminders for upcoming tasks.
Use the `deadline` command to add a task with a deadline.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Use the `event` command to add an event with a start and end date.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Use the `list` command to display all your tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Use `mark` or `unmark` followed by the task number to update completion.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Use the `delete` command followed by the task number.
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Use the `on` command with a date to see all tasks for that date.
Use the `find` command with a keyword to search tasks.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Use the `remind` command with the number of days to see upcoming tasks.
Here are your upcoming tasks within 7 days:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

* Handles saving and loading of {@link Task} objects to and from the disk.
* The {@code Storage} class abstracts away file I/O details, ensuring that
* tasks can be persisted across program runs. Tasks are stored one per line
* in a plain text file and encoded/decoded using {@link Task#encodeString()}
* Constructs a {@code Storage} object to manage a given file path.
* @param filePath the path to the file where tasks will be saved/loaded
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* Each line of the file is decoded into a {@link Task}. Invalid lines
* are skipped with a warning. If the file does not exist, an empty list
* @return a list of tasks loaded from file; empty if file is missing
* @throws DabotException if the file cannot be read due to I/O issues
throw new DabotException("Failed to load tasks: " + e.getMessage());
* Saves a list of tasks into the storage file.
* Each task is written on a new line using its encoded string form.
* Creates the file and parent directories if they do not exist.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to save
* @throws DabotException if the tasks cannot be saved due to I/O issues
public void save(List<Task> tasks) throws DabotException {
throw new DabotException("Failed to save tasks: " + e.getMessage());

* Constructs a {@code Deadline} with a description and a deadline string.

* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* The start and end times are stored both as raw strings

* objects when the input can be parsed in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format.
* Constructs a new {@code Event} with a description, start time, and end time.
* If the {@code startRaw} or {@code endRaw} strings are valid ISO dates
* ({@code yyyy-MM-dd}), they are also stored as {@link LocalDate} objects.
* Otherwise, the corresponding {@link LocalDate} field is set to {@code null}.
* @param startRaw    start time as entered by the user
* @param endRaw      end time as entered by the user
